main.name: Handy
main.description: Handy is a Hand Gesture Based Keyboard for the Blind. It is controlled through the use of American Sign Language (ASL) gestures
main.bio: Through real-time detection, Handy uses our custom object detection model that is capable of recognising over 42 different gestures. These include 0-9, A-Z and 6 special characters: enter, delete, space, number mode, lower-case and upper-case mode

motivation.description: Interacting with computers remains a challenge for the blind. Though braille-based keyboards are available, they usually have a limited number of keys. Interacting with computers via speech is another option; however, this is not a desirable solution in all situations, such as a competitive exam environment.

instructions.title: How to get started?
instructions.description: To begin using the app, just click on one of the 'Get Started' button and you will be directed to the model page.

instructions.title: Multi-Mode
instructions.description: To improve both model functionality and accuracy, a multi-mode system has been implemented on the app. These modes are number, lower-case and upper-case; when these gestures are signed and registerd, the model switches to that mode. The default mode is lower-case.

models.title: 3 Avaliable Models
models.description: Handy has 3 avaliable models to choose from. The default model, model 3, is the full-version of handy. This is a model capabale of detecting the full 42 gesture set, including the numbers, letters and special characters. Model 1 and 2 are faster models due to a more limited scope of detectable gestures. Model 1 is capable of detecting numbers 0-9; Model 2 is capable of detcting letters A-Z and the special characters.

tips.description: The audio feedback system has been integrated to inform blind users when a gesture has been detected. My recommendation is to keep the gesture upheld to your side for a just over a second or so until the audio prompt is heard.
